verses.verse: But it came to pass after <S%H3117><s%> a while <S%H3117><s%>, in the time of wheat <S%H2406><s%> harvest <S%H7105><s%>, that Samson <S%H8123><s%> visited <S%H6485><s%> his wife <S%H802><s%> with a kid <S%H1423><s%>; and he said <S%H559><s%>, I will go in <S%H935><s%> to my wife <S%H802><s%> into the chamber <S%H2315><s%>. But her father <S%H1><s%> would not suffer <S%H5414><s%> him to go in <S%H935><s%>.

And her father <S%H1><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, I verily <S%H559><s%> thought <S%H559><s%> that thou hadst utterly <S%H8130><s%> hated <S%H8130><s%> her <S%H5414><s%>; therefore I gave her to thy companion <S%H4828><s%>: is not her younger <S%H6996><s%> sister <S%H269><s%> fairer than she <S%H2896><s%>? take her, I pray thee, instead of her.

And Samson <S%H8123><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H6471><s%>, This time shall I be blameless <S%H5352><s%> in regard of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>, when I do <S%H6213><s%> them a mischief <S%H7451><s%>.

And Samson <S%H8123><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> and caught <S%H3920><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> foxes <S%H7776><s%>, and took <S%H3947><s%> firebrands <S%H3940><s%>, and turned <S%H6437><s%> tail <S%H2180><s%> to tail <S%H2180><s%>, and put <S%H7760><s%> a <S%H259><s%> firebrand <S%H3940><s%> in the midst <S%H8432><s%> between every two <S%H8147><s%> tails <S%H2180><s%>.

And when he had set <S%H1197><s%> the brands <S%H3940><s%> on fire <S%H784><s%>, he let them go <S%H7971><s%> into the standing grain <S%H7054><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>, and burnt up <S%H1197><s%> both the shocks <S%H1430><s%> and the standing grain <S%H7054><s%>, and also the oliveyards <S%H2132><s%>.

Then the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Who hath done <S%H6213><s%> this <S%H559><s%>? And they said, Samson <S%H8123><s%>, the son-in <S%H2860><s%>-law of the Timnite <S%H8554><s%>, because he hath taken <S%H3947><s%> his wife <S%H802><s%>, and given <S%H5414><s%> her to his companion <S%H4828><s%>. And the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%>, and burnt <S%H8313><s%> her and her father <S%H1><s%> with fire <S%H784><s%>.

And Samson <S%H8123><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H518><s%>, If ye do <S%H6213><s%> after this <S%H2063><s%> manner <S%H5358><s%>, surely I will be avenged of you <S%H310><s%>, and after that I will cease <S%H2308><s%>.

And he smote <S%H5221><s%> them hip <S%H7785><s%> and <S%H5921><s%> thigh <S%H3409><s%> with a great <S%H1419><s%> slaughter <S%H4347><s%>: and he went down <S%H3381><s%> and dwelt <S%H3427><s%> in the cleft <S%H5585><s%> of the rock <S%H5553><s%> of Etam <S%H5862><s%>.
Then the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> went up <S%H5927><s%>, and encamped <S%H2583><s%> in Judah <S%H3063><s%>, and spread <S%H5203><s%> themselves in Lehi <S%H3896><s%>.

And the men <S%H376><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Why are ye come up <S%H5927><s%> against us <S%H559><s%>? And they said, To bind <S%H631><s%> Samson <S%H8123><s%> are we come up <S%H5927><s%>, to do <S%H6213><s%> to him as he hath done to us <S%H6213><s%>.

Then three <S%H7969><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> men <S%H376><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> went <S%H3381><s%> down to the cleft <S%H5585><s%> of the rock <S%H5553><s%> of Etam <S%H5862><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> to Samson <S%H8123><s%>, Knowest <S%H3045><s%> thou not that the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> are rulers <S%H4910><s%> over us <S%H6213><s%>? what then is this that thou hast done unto us <S%H559><s%>? And he said unto them <S%H6213><s%>, As they did unto me <S%H6213><s%>, so have I done unto them.

And they said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H3381><s%>, We are come down to bind <S%H631><s%> thee <S%H5414><s%>, that we may deliver thee into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>. And Samson <S%H8123><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H7650><s%>, Swear unto me <S%H6293><s%>, that ye will not fall upon me yourselves.

And they spake <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H559><s%>, saying, No <S%H631><s%>; but we will bind thee fast <S%H631><s%>, and deliver <S%H5414><s%> thee into their hand <S%H3027><s%>: but surely <S%H4191><s%> we will not kill <S%H4191><s%> thee <S%H631><s%>. And they bound him with two <S%H8147><s%> new <S%H2319><s%> ropes <S%H5688><s%>, and brought him up <S%H5927><s%> from the rock <S%H5553><s%>.

When he came <S%H935><s%> unto Lehi <S%H3896><s%>, the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> shouted <S%H7321><s%> as <S%H7125><s%> they met him <S%H7307><s%>: and the Spirit of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> came mightily <S%H6743><s%> upon him <S%H5688><s%>, and the ropes that were upon his arms <S%H2220><s%> became as flax <S%H6593><s%> that was burnt <S%H1197><s%> with fire <S%H784><s%>, and his bands <S%H612><s%> dropped <S%H4549><s%> from off his hands <S%H3027><s%>.

And he found <S%H4672><s%> a fresh <S%H2961><s%> jawbone <S%H3895><s%> of an ass <S%H2543><s%>, and put forth <S%H7971><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%>, and took <S%H3947><s%> it <S%H5221><s%>, and smote a thousand <S%H505><s%> men therewith <S%H376><s%>.

And Samson <S%H8123><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, With the jawbone <S%H3895><s%> of an ass <S%H2543><s%>, heaps <S%H2565><s%> upon heaps <S%H2565><s%>, With the jawbone <S%H3895><s%> of an ass <S%H2543><s%> have I smitten <S%H5221><s%> a thousand <S%H505><s%> men <S%H376><s%>.

And it came to pass <S%H3615><s%>, when he had made an end of speaking <S%H1696><s%>, that he cast away <S%H7993><s%> the jawbone <S%H3895><s%> out of his hand <S%H3027><s%>; and that place <S%H4725><s%> was called <S%H7121><s%> Ramath-lehi <S%H7437><s%>.

And he was sore <S%H3966><s%> athirst <S%H6770><s%>, and called <S%H7121><s%> on Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, Thou hast given <S%H5414><s%> this great <S%H1419><s%> deliverance <S%H8668><s%> by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of thy servant <S%H5650><s%>; and now shall I die <S%H4191><s%> for thirst <S%H6772><s%>, and fall <S%H5307><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the uncircumcised <S%H6189><s%>.

But God <S%H430><s%> clave <S%H1234><s%> the hollow place <S%H4388><s%> that is in Lehi <S%H3895><s%>, and there came <S%H3318><s%> water <S%H4325><s%> thereout <S%H8354><s%>; and when he had drunk, his spirit <S%H7307><s%> came again <S%H7725><s%>, and he revived <S%H2421><s%>: wherefore the name <S%H8034><s%> thereof was called <S%H7121><s%> En-hakkore <S%H5875><s%>, which is in Lehi <S%H3896><s%>, unto this day <S%H3117><s%>.
And he judged <S%H8199><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> twenty <S%H6242><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>.
